alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 1:51AM EST until February 18 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...At 1005.0 feet, KY Route 66 north of Straight Creek bridge floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 1004.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by no later than 6 AM this morning and continue falling to around 991.1 feet around 1 PM EST today. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 6 AM EST.
